item.text: The Lord said to Jeremiah:

“<st data-num="08085" class="">Hear</st><n id="1" /> the <st data-num="01697" class="">terms</st> of <st data-num="02063" class="">the</st> <st data-num="01285" class="">covenant</st><n id="2" /> I made with Israel<n id="3" /> and <st data-num="01696" class="">pass</st> them <st data-num="01696" class="">on</st><n id="4" /> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0376" class="">people</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">and</st> the <st data-num="03427" class="">citizens</st> of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>.<n id="5" />
Tell them that the Lord, the God of Israel, says, ‘Anyone who does not keep the terms of the covenant will be under a curse.

Those are the terms <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">charged</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st><n id="1" /> to keep<n id="2" /> <st data-num="03117" class="">when</st> I <st data-num="03318" class="">brought</st> them out of <st data-num="0776 04714">Egypt</st>, that place that was like an <st data-num="01270" class="">iron</st>-smelting <st data-num="03564" class="">furnace</st>.<n id="3" /> I <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> at that time,<n id="4" /> “<st data-num="08085" class="">Obey</st> <st data-num="06963" class="">me</st> and <st data-num="06213" class="">carry out</st> the terms of the covenant<n id="5" /> <st data-num="03605" class="">exactly</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> you. If you do,<n id="6" /> you will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> my <st data-num="05971" class="">people</st> and <st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> your <st data-num="0430" class="">God</st>.<n id="7" />

Then I will keep the promise I swore on oath to your ancestors to give them a land flowing with milk and honey.” That is the very land that you still live in today.’” And I responded, “Amen. Let it be so, Lord.”
The Lord said to me, “Announce all the following words in the towns of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: ‘Listen to the terms of my covenant with you and carry them out!

<st data-num="03588" class="">For</st> I <st data-num="05749" class="">solemnly</st> <st data-num="05749" class="">warned</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">to</st> <st data-num="08085" class="">obey</st> <st data-num="06963" class="">me</st>.<n id="1" /> I <st data-num="05749" class="">warned</st> them <st data-num="07925" class="">again and again</st>,<n id="2" /> ever <st data-num="03117" class="">since</st> I <st data-num="05927" class="">delivered</st> them out of <st data-num="0776 04714">Egypt</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.

But they did not listen to me or pay any attention to me! Each one of them followed the stubborn inclinations of his own wicked heart. So I brought on them all the punishments threatened in the covenant because they did not carry out its terms as I commanded them to do.’”
The Lord said to me, “The people of Judah and the citizens of Jerusalem have plotted rebellion against me.

They have <st data-num="07725" class="">gone back</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="05771" class="">evil ways</st><n id="1" /> of their <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st> <st data-num="07223" class="">of old</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="03985" class="">refused</st> to <st data-num="08085" class="">obey</st> <st data-num="01697" class="">what</st> I <st data-num="01697" class="">told</st> them. <st data-num="01992" class="">They</st>, too, have <st data-num="01980 0310">paid allegiance to</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="0312" class="">other</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> and <st data-num="05647" class="">worshiped</st> them. Both the <st data-num="01004" class="">nation</st> of <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> and the <st data-num="01004" class="">nation</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st><n id="3" /> have <st data-num="06565" class="">violated</st> the <st data-num="01285 0834">covenant</st> I <st data-num="03772" class="">made</st> <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> their <st data-num="01" class="">ancestors</st>.
So I, the Lord, say this: ‘I will soon bring disaster on them that they will not be able to escape! When they cry out to me for help, I will not listen to them.

Then those <st data-num="03427" class="">living</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> and in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> will<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01980" class="">go</st> and <st data-num="02199" class="">cry out for help</st> <st data-num="0413" class="">to</st> the <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> to <st data-num="0834" class="">whom</st> <st data-num="01992" class="">they</st> have been <st data-num="06999" class="">sacrificing</st>. However, those gods will <st data-num="03467" class="">by</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">no</st> <st data-num="03467" class="">means be able</st><n id="2" /> to <st data-num="03467" class="">save</st> them <st data-num="06256" class="">when</st> <st data-num="07451" class="">disaster</st> <st data-num="06256" class="">strikes</st> them.

<st data-num="03588" class="">This is in spite of the fact that</st><n id="1" /> the people of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">have</st> as <st data-num="04557" class="">many</st> <st data-num="0430" class="">gods</st> as they have <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st><n id="2" /> and the citizens of <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st> have <st data-num="07760" class="">set up</st> as <st data-num="04557" class="">many</st> <st data-num="04196" class="">altars</st> to <st data-num="06999" class="">sacrifice</st> to that <st data-num="01322" class="">disgusting</st> god, <st data-num="01168" class="">Baal</st>, as they have <st data-num="02351" class="">streets</st> in the city!’<n id="3" />
But as for you, Jeremiah, do not pray for these people. Do not raise a cry of prayer for them. For I will not listen to them when they call out to me for help when disaster strikes them.”

The Lord says to the people of Judah,

“What right do you have to be in my temple, my beloved people?

Many of you have done wicked things.

Can your acts of treachery be so easily canceled by sacred offerings

that you take joy in doing evil even while you make them?

I, the Lord, once called you a thriving olive tree,

one that produced beautiful fruit.

But I will set you on fire,

fire that will blaze with a mighty roar.

Then all your branches will be good for nothing.

For though I, the Lord of Heaven’s Armies, planted you in the land,

I now decree that disaster will come on you

because the nations of Israel and Judah have done evil

and have made me angry by offering sacrifices to the god Baal.”

The Lord gave me knowledge, that I might have understanding.

Then he showed me what the people were doing.

Before this I had been like a docile lamb ready to be led to the slaughter.

I did not know they were making plans to kill me.

I did not know they were saying,

“Let’s destroy the tree along with its fruit!

Let’s remove Jeremiah from the world of the living

so people will not even be reminded of him anymore.”

So I said,

“O Lord of Heaven’s Armies, you are a just judge!

You examine people’s hearts and minds.

I want to see you pay them back for what they have done

because I trust you to vindicate my cause.”
Then the Lord told me about some men from Anathoth who were threatening to kill me. They had threatened, “Stop prophesying in the name of the Lord or we will kill you!”
So the Lord of Heaven’s Armies said, “I will surely punish them! Their young men will be killed in battle. Their sons and daughters will die of starvation.
Not one of them will survive. I will bring disaster on those men from Anathoth who threatened you. A day of reckoning is coming for them.”
